ygData.subject: What does the ".invalid" suffix on an ARC file mean?
ygData.msgSnippet: My big crawl died: WUI completely unresponsive (could not even connect). Logs indicate memory problems. I m left with 29 (!) arc files with the .gz.open

Subject: What does the ".invalid" suffix on an ARC file mean?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=6903103
X-Yahoo-Profile: tree02139

My big crawl died: WUI completely unresponsive (could not even
connect). Logs indicate memory problems. I'm left with 29 (!) arc
files with the ".gz.open" suffix (when only 5 were in the pool) and 5
arc files with the ".gz.invalid" suffix. What does .invalid mean
(besides the obvious connotation that these are, well, invalid, which
they are, according to gunzip --test).

Thirteen of the 29 of the .open ARCs are 0-length.

    -tree
